title: Quiz 3: Obstetric Anatomy (The Pelvis)
description: Evaluation of pelvic bones, joints, types, and critical diameters for delivery.

questions.question: Which type of pelvis is described as the 'true female pelvis', having a rounded brim and a generous fore-pelvis?

richContent.content: Clinical Note: This pelvis shape is found in 50% of women and is ideal for childbearing.

questions.explanation: The Gynaecoid pelvis is the classic female shape, optimal for fetal head rotation and delivery.

questions.question: Match the pelvic type with its characteristic brim shape:
questions.explanation: Gynaecoid=Round; Android=Heart (Male); Anthropoid=Long Oval (Ape); Platypelloid=Flat Kidney.

questions.question: The ___BLANK___ conjugate is measured from the upper border of the symphysis pubis to the sacral promontory and measures ___BLANK___ cm.
questions.explanation: The anatomical conjugate is 12cm. The obstetric conjugate (available space) is 11cm.
questions.hint: This is the anatomical measurement, not the obstetric one.

questions.question: Which pelvic diameter is the shortest and represents the actual space available for the passage of the foetus at the brim?
questions.explanation: The Obstetrical conjugate measures ~11cm and is the critical narrowest point at the inlet.
questions.hint: It is named after the specialty of childbirth.

questions.question: Which bones make up the Innominate Bone? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: The Innominate bone (hip bone) is fused from the Ilium, Ischium, and Pubis. The Sacrum is a separate bone in the pelvis.
questions.hint: The Sacrum is at the back; the hip bone has three parts.

questions.question: The Android pelvis predisposes the foetus to an Occipito-Posterior position.
questions.explanation: The heart shape and narrow fore-pelvis of the Android pelvis force the head to occupy the posterior space.
questions.hint: Android pelvises often cause difficult labour.

questions.question: Which landmark on the pelvic brim is formed by the upper border of the first sacral vertebra jutting forward?
questions.explanation: The sacral promontory is the prominent projection at the back of the pelvic inlet.
questions.hint: It is a 'promontory' on the sacrum.

questions.question: Order the landmarks of the pelvic brim starting from Posterior to Anterior:

items.text: Upper inner border of Symphysis Pubis

questions.hint: Start at the back (sacrum) and move to the front.

questions.question: What is the measurement of the Transverse Diameter of the pelvic outlet?
questions.explanation: The transverse diameter of the outlet (between ischial tuberosities) is 10-11 cm.
questions.hint: It is measured between the 'sitting bones'.

questions.question: Which pelvic floor muscle acts as a strong diaphragm slung like a hammock to support pelvic organs?
questions.explanation: The Levator Ani is the principal muscle of the pelvic floor.
